definitions: in a way that conforms with generally accepted standards of respectable or moral behavior

examples.text: parents can teach their children how to behave decently

shortDefinitions: in way that conforms with generally accepted standards of respectable or moral behaviour

definitions: to a fair and appropriate degree; fittingly

examples.text: they would like to be decently paid for the work they do

definitions: in a manner that is not likely to shock or embarrass others

examples.text: she must dress decently and not flash too much flesh

shortDefinitions: in manner that is not likely to shock or embarrass others

definitions: to an acceptable or comfortable standard; satisfactorily

examples.text: the chances of getting enough cash to live decently are poor
he batted decently but not spectacularly
the thriller was decently received by reviewers
